p:
Next, we explain the equation for determining the number of infected individuals. Given the recovered rate γ during a time period, the number of infected individuals at the end of the time period t is equal to the initial infected cases minus the new recovered cases plus the new infected cases:
(2)
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{upgreek} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} }{}\begin{eqnarray*}{I}_{a,j,t}={I}_{a,j,t-1}-\gamma {I}_{a,j,t-1}+\Delta {I}_{a,j,t-1}.\end{eqnarray*}\end{document}

a , j , t
=
